Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Small room - typical for London but well worth the money as very cheap rates and great location! Clean and 24 hours reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Islam_Barakat
Reviews.Content: We have to agree that we should be subjective in our in our expectations for a hotel that you can pay GBP25 a night! If you expecting that you are staying in Hilton where you would pay GBP 220 (almost 10 times) then do not even think about it … This is a budget hotel, that you pay the minimum money you can pay, in return for a privet room in amazing location in central London … simply for a comfort sleep under a roof in a clean place with a privet bathroom..for only GBP 25 If you want to compare this hotel you should compare it with Hostels … I’m not expecting when I’m evaluating a Hostel I would not do it based on a Hotel standards Conclusion… this hotel is not appropriate for families, but would be a very good options for singles and youth

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: TsvetelinaR
Reviews.Content: The staff did not understand English very well. No elevator, extremely steep stairs. My room was in the basement. Rooms & Bathrooms - terribly small and dirthy; Breakfast - poor (consisting of bread, jam and yellow cheese only). Location - close to Paddington Station (10 min. by walk) and Мarble Arche (30 min. by walk) - the only nice thing about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “prince william hotel”
Reviews.Author: shucky1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice cheap place to stay in paddington TRUST ME when i say this is not it very poor service ,breakfast is cold tea and toast ,broken toilet seats ,dirty sheets,doors that dont fit,hope this review helps many people. i certainly wont be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “very poor hotel be warned”
Reviews.Author: jade c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Prince Edward Hotel online a few days before arriving in London. We wanted to stay in Paddington, so we came across hundreds of hotels and this one popped up and looked to be very good in the photos. The price was about 40 Australian dollars more than want we anticipated paying but we thought what the hell it is only for 3 nights and yeah the hotel looks great in the photos. The reception was run by a pair of Indians who tried very hard but I just don't think they had a lot of experience in hospitality. We arrived a bit early and they allowed us to put the bags in the storage room which was great and we headed off for a walk and to exchange some money. The first impression was quite O.K it was neat and tidy and had plenty of brochures on the tourist activities. We checked in at 3pm, they gave us the key and headed up the stairs to room 25. The stairs are narrow and very steep not recommended to anyone a bit older than us as they are dangerous. We unlocked our door to find an extremely small room, clearly an old cupboard they decided to place a double bed in and install a toilet and shower. Seriously it was so small and literally it was only suited to 1 person. We had to work as a team if one of us wanted to go to the bathroom as one had to be at the end of the bed to allow enough room to get past. The room at only a bed cupboard chair and bathroom. Everything was so small. The bathroom is very outdated and needs a revamp. The toilet is tiny and paint is peeling off around the seat, there was also several large cracks on the roof and you were unable to open any windows to get fresh air. The only air circulating option is a tiny fan that was noisier than the buses and cars that were driving past. The staff were atrocious we asked to book a day trip to Stone Henge as we were very keen to check it out. On the brochure it says to book through your hotel reception. Our main man in the reception had no idea and eventually called us and said the early tour is full and the afternoon tour is not operating which is not true. We gave up. Also on checkout the receptionist checked us out and said have a good day. I said how about my deposit, and he said oh ok and asked for the receipt. I thought this was poor, as he was clearly trying to get me out of there so he could keep the deposit. Do not recommend this hotel as it is terrible. The breakfast is poor, we found mouldy bread in the bread bin and there was no water so we were stuck to drink very sweat orange juice. Simply we will not recommend this hotel to family or friends and honestly would not allow our little dog to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “needs very much updating”
Reviews.Author: bevyweby
Reviews.Content: although reviews were bad for this hotel i figured how bad could it be..well let me tell you....the room was in the basement down appx 13 stairs (the lift was broken)..so i hobbled down there fore had to leave suitcase in main lobby... room was old and dirty...needed cleaning...although towels were clean and there was soap and tea/coffee available. reviews had said springs came out of matresses and they were right....springs were popping out hotel needs a full makeover

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SydneytouristAus
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware! Please listen to the majority of reviews, which correctly describe the appalling standard of this "hotel". We booked this hotel to allow us to spend an extra couple of days in london. Upon checking in, we had to climb 8 flights of grubby stairs, to scour the maze of rooms, unaided to reach our cell. Unable to find floorspace once our small bags were in the room, we sought refuge on the very small, terribly uncomfortable and dirty trundle bed. Nothing in this room looks to have ever been washed or repaired, the curtains are broken, allowing neighbors to look straight in, the drains in the shower/ basin are blocked and we would be better off sleeping on the floor than the threadbare mattress, through which every spring protrudes. We found the general attitude of the staff unhelpful, after mentioning our mattress issue we were told to ask the morning after (our sleepless night). In the morning we were given the key to another "better" room, which hadn't been serviced, to discover the same problems. The location of this hotel is definitely NOT an excuse for the rates being this high. ANY hotel/ hostel/ under bridge accommodation will be vastly superior. If you can't get any accommodation in London for the weekend and this is your only option... Stay in Paris, or bring a bed, blankets, curtains, drain-o and bleach with you.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone said”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte R
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 friends had read some of the reviews of this hotel before we arrived and were expecting a dank, dirty, noisy hotel with tiny rooms and unpleasant staff. However we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were friendly and our room was a perfectly adequate size, enough room for the luggage of 3 teenage girls. Admittedly the hotel was quite old, but it was clean, towels were changed and beds made every day and the bathroom was small but clean. Our room consisted of a double bed and a camp bed, which my friend said was comfier than her own bed at home. The 2 major problems were the heat, as the room did get hot at night and although a fan was provided it was still stifling, and the fact that the lift was broken, and we were on the top (5th) floor. However, we only paid Â£30 each a night, and so I would say we got our money's worth. I would recommend this hotel for young people; it is a good base for visiting the city as it is close to the centre and tube/bus stops, as long as you aren't expecting too much from a very cheap and cheerful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love this little place but not pleased.”
Reviews.Author: RosterPreston
Reviews.Content: I was taking my daughter on vacation her to show her what her Dad and I did 10 years ago when we came. I wanted to stay in the same places so we did. The location is close to the underground and near all the attractions. We needed a double for 3 of the nights and then a triple for 2 of the nights. We had to pay for a triple for all 5 nights because they were "booked." The triple was a double with a third twin bed put in it. Which made three of the four walls covered with bed and they all touched so it was pretty much wall to wall bed other than a narrow walkway from the door to the window. The mattress have to be the same wore out mattress that they had on the beds 10 years ago. It was so warm I slept on top of the covers and had put an extra blanket on top of the mattress. The air temp was very uncomfortable due to the time of year and NO AC. We had a very small fan. The staff was very kind. The breakfast was corn flakes, white or brown toast, Coffee, tea, milk, cheese, butter and jam. I will not be staying at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A total nightmare, stay away, sleep in the park”
Reviews.Author: ridambehet
Reviews.Content: worst hotel if you can call it that, rooms are like dog box, lift doesnâ€™t work, internet doesnâ€™t work, dirty, shame these people are in business DO NOT, AND I MEAN DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Tulipz_11
Reviews.Content: I'm a seasoned traveler and always manage to find comfortable hotel through internet booking. When I first arrived at this hotel, I was so shocked, the room was so small, nothing like being shown on the internet, I could hardly walk in the room since there's only enough space to put our luggage. To make things worse, the sheet and the bathroom was dirty, I even get bug bites in the room. What I was so angry was, the male Indian receptionist was so rude to my family, the worse service ever!!!!!! The reason I stayed at the hotel was because others were fully booked, and I advise others not to stay at this hotel, because it sucks in every way.

Reviews.Title: “dont go there”
Reviews.Author: jusmelhay
Reviews.Content: The lift wasnt working which meant we had to climb 3 flights of stairs to this tiny dirty bedroom where we couldnt even open our suitcases. We had to put them on the bed which I didnt want to, so I certainly wasnt going to sleep in it.We walked out and found another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “horrendous!!!! filthy”
Reviews.Author: amandablood
Reviews.Content: I would like to let you know about the hotel that we were to stay in for three nights, first of all it was filthy,dirty, the springs in the mattress was poking out the bed, under the sheet there was a folded cover to try and stop the springs popping out, the bed spread was all stained and smelt. the nets was black with muck,the curtains was hanging down, the so called rug was filthy, the paint work was filthy, even the windows was sealed with masking tape, i have never ever seen or been in a hotel like this, we were disgusted in it , i mentioned the bed etc to the woman on the desk all she said was i can get you some more covers to put on the mattress to stop the springs, i was horrified, i have spondilosis in my spine and the expected me to sleep on that bed!! i asked for a refund as there is no way i was staying a moment more in that place, i think sleeping on the street with the homeless would of been better, we ended up staying at a travel lodge as there is no way i would of slept there, BE WARNED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as they say...”
Reviews.Author: salmanella
Reviews.Content: I seriously don't know why this place gets so much flack. I stayed at prince william for a weekend back in january 2011 n i found it very comfortable and convenient. We stayed in room G4 which was well stocked and the staff were helpful but pretty glum, its london and u shudn't expect any less. it may not b a 5 star hotel but its great value for money and the location is perfect, close to paddington tube station. don't let the reviews deter you, i would highly recommend this place as a good value-for-money hotel if your plannin on stain in town for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “a little tired”
Reviews.Author: grabearPortsmouthUk
Reviews.Content: a budget hotel in need of updating. Not mearly a little tired but exhusted. Cutains that were falling off their poles and very dirty, a scruffy bed throw, cheap laminate flooring, a TV with no ariel, trailing electrical leads, a kettle with nowhere to plug it in, Tea bags that looked very old and no milk. The free continental breakfast was no more than a choice of sliced white or brown bread, a small plate of sliced cheese and a toaster which sometimes worked if you held the knob down. On the up side, the entrance lounge was inviting and the hotel is central for sight seeing. would i stay there again. NO!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Kristof_10
Reviews.Content: No place to go ... not your money worth - bad room - bad bed - no service in restaurant - minimal breakfast - no friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bundy2150
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. We arrived on a Friday and were given a room on the 4th floor, room 47 to be precise. You couldn't swing a cat in this room. I complained about the room as it really wasn't worth Â£50 (discounted rate). The TV didn't have a remote control as stated on the website. As for Satellite TV, Dream on. The man on reception said we needed to speak to someone the following day. The following day we went down for breakfast, which consisted of 2 cereals, toast and Easy singles cheese. I asked for a full English for an extra Â£3. I thought there was a smell of wet dog when the breakfast was served to me. I then complained about our room and when we returned to our hotel in the evening we were moved to a twin room that was slightly more spacious. At this stage I gave up complaining until we were checking out when I was told our Â£6.95 charge would incur a charge of Â£3 if using a credit card. I then asked if we could speak to a manager only to be told that there was no manager there and that they only work from 10am to 4pm. I asked if they could contact me, but the only way to make contact was for me to email the hotel. I thought this would be a better way to warn people of this place. I'm thinking of reporting this hotel to the hotel standards, as they have incorrectly advertised. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience - robbed!”
Reviews.Author: bccmee
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say but I was a victim of theft at this hotel. A valuable item was stolen from my room. I found this hotel in a good location at a reasonable rate. On my first night, my room was beside the elevator and it was very noisy because the door banged and people would be coming and going at all hours. On my second night, my room was changed. The front desk clerk said my new room was not ready but my belongings would be moved while I was out for the day. When I returned home late last night, I was repacking and discovered that an item worth 500 USD was missing. I am absolutely positive I left it in the room. Yes, I know there are signs that say the hotel is 'not responsible for valuables left in the rooms' but I cannot carry everything with me all day. I didn't expect that this gave them license to steal. Super disappointed. When I asked to look through their lost and found items they said they didn't have any. I guess it's finders-keepers at the Prince William Hotel in London, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and compact, a place to stay near Paddington Station”
Reviews.Author: dimsum888
Reviews.Content: Was offered a basement room next to the lift, can hear the creaking of the floor above. It's a very basic hotel with the room tiny but was all I needed for my stay in London, being in Zone 1 and relatively near Paddington station. Breakfast wasn't very substantial, was offered toast by the waitress and self-service cereals and cheese, juice was running out by the time I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “wedding present”
Reviews.Author: petie020
Reviews.Content: very shabby unfriendly no bar or restrant to eat in had to go out side down staires to a indian ikea beds no duty manger on duty messages between staff not passed on spoilt our honeymoon wont go back

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: RoskildeHotmama
Reviews.Content: My daugther and I want to spend some days in London, for sightseeing and shopping and musical, and we donÂ´t want to spend to much for hotel, but want to stay central. This hotel is just 300 m from Paddington station, clean an nice.,... good service, nice staff, ordinary breakfast inc..... But the hotel is very old and in a bad shape, the carpet is in a mess and the beds at terrible, we said to them when we left, that they should get some new madresses for the beds because they were to bad, my daugther are very thin, so we put a blanket folded in 6 layers under her, so she could sleep a bit better.... But all in all, cheap, clean an central. We donÂ´t hersitate to come back an other time....

Reviews.Title: “great value for money, very practical”
Reviews.Author: Hajar11
Reviews.Content: I have come to london for a week, mostly for shopping! the reviews make this place look like a nightmare, although for the cost i think its pretty good. i will agree that its not top of the range, and you cant get much better. however, for me it was perfect. I spend most of my days outdoors, shopping, and just come back in the evening to sleep. I'd rather spend the money on shopping than on a posh hotel which im barely going to be in. The location is great! easy access to almost anything. some of the rooms are a bit small, while others are a little spacious. Although, they dont really have top of the range furniture. The bathrooms were clean and really nice.They also have wireless for only Â£3.99 per 12 hours. Service was good! i had a problem with the sink, when i got back it was all sorted out. Breakfast is standard, not much of variety but food tasted great. overall if your trip is for shopping and sightseeing i would strongly recommend this hotel; however, if your coming to london for relaxation and to stick around in the hotel, then this wouldn't be your best option.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: flood423
Reviews.Content: Put in a stuffy basement room with no windows to open. Deliveries came to the basement from very early morning the opening and closing of doors left the corridor very noisey. Next morning we went to the dining room again in the basement the staff did even say good morning we were left to fend for ourselves, the juice was warm the cereal was cheap and horrible then we asked for an english breakfast (which we had paid extra for) it too was horrible and we could not eat it, so had to go out and buy elsewhere. How this hotel ever passed the health and safety regulations I will never know, the wiring was a joke with trailing sockets everywhere. Wires were taped accross floors and hid under mats. On the plus side we were only there for 3 nights, it was somewere to sleep, the towels were fresh and clean and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Johnraye
Reviews.Content: Provided that you don't pay the full rack rate and are able to get a good discount on the room price then this is really an excellent place to stay when in London. Situated near Hyde Park, many attractions are within a reasonable walking distance. My room was very quiet although I suspect that may not have been the case elsewhere in the hotel. Breakfast was basic but adequate. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NJSEA911
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend. Very clean and staff very helpful. The room was small, but I did not spend much time in the room. The bathroom was also small, very clean and the shower was very good. Would give a thumbs up here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!”
Reviews.Author: Iituli
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a 5 year old daughter and was a bit worried after reading the reviews here, but we were pleasently surprised after arriving to the hotel. Room was clean and bathroom was nice. Breakfast ok: toast, cheese, cereals, juice , coffee/tea. I would go to this hotel again with my children.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it....”
Reviews.Author: Brotherssp
Reviews.Content: OMG this place is poor... The rooms are small and dirty. It was so bad that I stayed for 10 mins and then checked out.... I've never done that before.. You have been warned...

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly Surpised”
Reviews.Author: yedra78
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive about our stay at Prince William after reading the other reviews however, our stay was a pleasant surprise. -If you arrive early, be prepared to wait until 3pm to check-in. They make no exceptions. There is luggage storage facilities. -Rooms small but cleanish except old blood stain on my linens. -Bathrooms are nice and clean. Our shaving/make-up mirror was non-functioning maintenance replaced it, but i still didn't work. -Tea and coffee making facilities are in the room -Breakfast consisted of toast (wheat and white bread), cheese, juice (apple and orange) and tea and coffee -South Asian restaurant takes over the breakfast area in the evenings. The food was pretty good and was reasonably priced. -Limited TV channels. The sound would go in and out. - The staff was efficient with no flexibility to the rules. -The lift is old and bucks when it stops. Try not get a room near the lift. -The location is great and for that reason I would go back. It is close to Paddington tube and train station and many bus stops that lead to all the main sites of London. -In walking distance to Kensington/Hyde Park. -We felt safe there as 2 female travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad !”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterza1
Reviews.Content: Was nervous after reading some of the reviews.Rooms bit small,but bathroom was good,location the best,staff average,clean but decor below par.By London standards for a person that spends most of the day outside ,this is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It makes the money!”
Reviews.Author: MarleneRomania
Reviews.Content: Very nice 2* hotel, clean, kind staff, very very good location at 3-5 minutes from Paddington station and tube, in Central London. I recommend it for those who want to visit London due to its location. Also is very close of Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park. Maybe the rooms are too tiny but it is not a spa hotel. I highly appreciated the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “It is worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Tomtata
Reviews.Content: Advantages: Good public transport and cheap restaurants nearby, ready and kind staff, fairly clean, reasonable prize. Disadvantages: Ragged furniture and carpets, thin walls (you can hear your neighbour snoring), small rooms, only 6 TV channels (2 of them the same).

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: EuVou
Reviews.Content: Noisy, with children running around! Small bedroom, unconfortable bed and awfull luggage storage area.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: londontr4vellers
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect much for the hotel, especially after we were reading these reviews before our trip. In fact I was even little worried about what we would get there. But fortunately I worried for nothing, the hotel was surprisingly good. Though the room was very tiny and bed was a little bit uncomfortable, we didn't found anything else to complain (except that the TV didn't worked, or perhaps we didn't know how to use it). When we arrived, our room was clean and cleaner changed the towels and pillowcases every day during our stay. First time I tried to use the tap, I got only boiling hot water from there and couldn't get it turn to colder. But then my boyfriend figured out how it worked. There is two switchs, hot and cold and you just have to turn them both to make the balance. Even though the bed has springs popping out, there was surprisingly good to sleep. In fact my boyfriend had a backache before we went to this holiday, but after first night in that bed the backache was gone... :) I complained about the bed at first, but after all I slept very well for all week. Okay, you should take earplugs with you if you have problems to sleep because the walls are very thin and you can hear all the noises from the hallway. We recommended this hotel for those who just need a place to sleep, have a shower and preserve their things safely. During our visit the hotel staff were very friendly and served us politely, we felt ourselves welcomed. Paddington was very nice and cosy area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take this hotel...please...”
Reviews.Author: Alfil1313
Reviews.Content: I was reading some reviews and I don't know why I didn't take the advise of others...really, I don't know :-( I don't know how to describe the hotel... Just, don't go... The room was so small that I had to go OVER my girlfriend in order to exit the bed...yes..believe... The double bed had ONLY one side out of the wall...so, each time I/she want to go out the bed, we had to jump over the other. The service...really bad. The people are not friendly and never, I say, NEVER they smile to us. The TV had only 3 chains and no remote control... no way to make understand the receptionist that they shoud check it... The electrical cables (and, believe, I know what I'm talking about) where without protections and were a danger for people. The breakfast machines for bread, coffee...etc, didn't work!!! Well, probably you are reading and thinking that I'm hard with them...but, just before going to the room, read the guest book in the left of the entrance...you will see some "nice" comments that people did before you. If you want to know more about, don't hesitate to contact me.. alfil1313@gmail.com Regards.

Reviews.Title: “Please please don't contribut to this horrible establishment!!!”
Reviews.Author: soxfan5
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin, so I will just try my best. This was by FAR the most DISGUSTING and terrible hotel I have ever stayed in. The location of it, sure it was nice, close to Paddington, but not worth it! The first room we were put in was the size of a infant's shoebox. All the room was able to fit in it was a rickety old double bed (yes, rickety, it creaked and swayed when you sat on it). The Big Screen tv in the room was about 9-10 inches I'd say, and the hotel didn't provide binoculars so you couldn't watch it from the bed. It also only received about 6 channels, three or four of which played the same program. The bathroom was about the size of a nice sized port o'potty. Oh and the smell of the joint, the hotel as a whole that is, honest to god, my friend threw up upon entering the lobby. No joke, not exaggerating, she vomited outside the front steps. She was feeling a bit queasy that day due to the traveling, but she managed to keep it down for an hour and a half bus ride, then another 25 minute walk. Upon encountering that alluring aroma, all hell broke loose. The hotel staff, yet another treat. We were hassled about having another girl come upstairs with us to our room. He kept calling the room telling us we weren't allowed to have visitors stay past 11!! That was beyond strange. Anyway, in order for her to stay with us we had to pay another 30 pounds!! We got ripped off, majorly. At least we got to be put in a different room, this time a triple, with a surprisingly more modern bathroom. But in this room the beds were just as bad, very uncomfortable with coils sticking out. After sleeping in them I think we all should have gone and got tetnis shots. The room was also conveniently located next to the Indian restaurant attached and wait for it, the laundry/utility room, so we were awakened by the angelic sounds of banging, clanking and pounding. I don't know how well they clean the rooms because in the drawers of the one and only nightstand was garbage from a previous guest which included crumpled papers, napkins, receipts, brochures and other miscellaneous papers. But to top it off, my favorite part of the hotel, in the top drawer there lay a single dirty miniature metal spoon (very cute) and a used pair of broken airline headphones (finders keepers). I understand people just want a cheap place to sleep and shower, but please go elsewhere, establishments like these should be forced to raise their standards of accommodations for travelers such as ourselves. There are places just as cheap, or possibly a few bucks more that you don't have to get deloused after staying there. Good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever vistited”
Reviews.Author: jennifersometimes
Reviews.Content: I have never been so traumatized in my life. I was trapped in the shower while scalding hot water was pouring on my body. I asked for my boyfriend to be allowed to stay with me and for an extra room and they insisted on making me pay extra for it. I lost a day of travel due to the burns, trauma and pain. No one seemed interested in compensating me for my trauma. The hotel was also dinky and as described on their website, there is no internet or satellite available. I would not recommended this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Liisamarie78
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at Prince William Hotel for a long weekend. The location is excellent, Paddington station is really close by, maybe 3-minute walking, which is really convenient. The hotel isn't a 5-star hotel, but did fulfill our needs: a bed to sleep in for few hours and a hot shower. The room was really cold when we got in, but after turning the heater, it was ok for the rest of the stay. The traffic noise was really loud, I recommend bringing ear plugs (we stayed on the first floor). You could smell curry once we got in the hotel, but not in our room. Realistically, we got a good deal. But we weren't expecting a Ritz to start with.

Reviews.Title: “More dirty hostel than hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirlie81
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the internet for me, my mother and aunt. From the second we arrived i knew it was a mistake!! From the tiny lobby, and odd reception not to mention the stale smell. I The staff were unfriendly to say the least, having poor english, hardly spoke a word just handed us our keys and pointed in the direction of the stairs leading down stairs to the basement. The lift if you can call it that, fits one plus suitcase and looked about 100 yrs old. When we got to our rooms the thought dungon sprang to mind as it was nothing more!! I cannot discribe the smell of urine it smelled as if something had died in there. The bathroom tiles, basin and bath were stained and cracked and not big enough to turn round in. The window was borded up and had bars on, the sheets and bed covers were a suspicious shade of yellow and the beds were lumpy! when we complained we were met by cold hostility as the girl shouted no smell no smell at us! she then agreed to give us other rooms on the second floor, but we soon found these were of a similar standard. I felt like i was going to cry it was so bad. We agreed there was no way we could stay in this disgraceful place. We went down to the lobby to tell the manager we wanted a refund, to find the full amount had already been taken from our card. The girl told us there was no manager for us to speek to through broken english. I said i found that hard to believe as it was 4 o'clock on a tuesday. she said we wouldn't get our money anyway!! I didn't care i would rather sleep on the street so left. We decided to check out other hotels near, and as a almost joke went into the hilton across the road to enquire the price. we were shocked to find the hilton charged only 8 pounds more!!!! With brakefast for three only Â£20 extra. Our stay in the Hilton was Amazing,a real treat, Clean, friendly staff nice food well worth the extra Â£28!! So my advise to you is avoid the flea pit prince william and go to the Hilton!!!! I cannot stress it enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: macy78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, very close to Paddington station. The staff were quite pleasant, the room was fine apart from the mattress being a little lumpy. I would give it a 6-7/10 for cleanliness. Adequate breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful, appauling and horrid”
Reviews.Author: AvSteR100
Reviews.Content: Im so built up with disgust I dont know where to begin. Let me start by saying... I beg you, please dont stay here. I booked this hotel online obviously looking for something basic and reasonably cheap in the heart of London. It cost me 69 pounds at the time or roughly $150 AUD - I am aware that London is very expensive and was happy to pay that for what i thought would be basic but liveable however boy was i wrong!!! Please read below for my account: - On check in we were greated with an empty desk for almost 10 minutes - Once given our room we found it was down a staircase resembling a verticle drop and not wide enough to fit my back pack. You can imagine how dangerous this was and the difficulty to manage after a 20 hour flight let alone assisting my girlfriend with her luggage. - Once finally getting into our room I was pleased to find our room was situated under the staircase I had just gone flying down and next door to a public toilet for guests. - The room resembled a jail cell. Not wide enough to open luggage, a TV that could be watched with a magnifying glass, a bathroom that i had to suck in my stomach to fit into and a window that looked directly out to a beautiful brick wall. - The bed was the best part of this room - the mattress was designed in a semi circle. It was to short so my legs dangled, the pillow was as thick as an A4 piece of paper and through out the night my Girlfriend and I rolled into eachother in the middle of the bed as the semi circle/slant of the mattress took affect. One positive of this hotel was the breakfast. After waking to the magnificant view of the brick wall and the stench of urin from next door not to mention people crashing down the stairs above us. Breakfast provided a haven. Bread that couldnt be toasted because the toaster had no power. Cheese that was harder then the brick wall i woke up looking at and some spreads (actually make that a spread - jam) By half way through our stay we went out for breakfast - we couldnt bare to be in that hotel for a second longer. Finally as our flight out of London was at 4am i arrose at around 2 to go to reception to ask the man behind the desk if he could check for delays on my flight. He said he could not (but I saw him using internet on facebook and looking up websites). His reasoning was that guests could not use the internet so i then had to call the airline and sit on my mobile phone for 10 minutes. I give this hotel a -10/10. Prince William would not allow himself to be burried here. p.s when i booked they mentioned renovations had recently been completed as i walked in the sign on the wall was (we apologise for the decor renovations in progress - I have no doubt this sign still exists today.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever - Completely Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: DSievers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked stays in this hotel to be close to Paddington Station to get to Heathrow between trips to Ireland and back home to the States. The first time we stayed there we went to sign in and were told that the credit card machine was down and we'd need to pay in cash. I stated that I did not have that much on me and was unaware that I would be needing to pay in cash as no call was made before our arrival. Either way I went to get the cash - was then told that I wouldn't get a reciept until the room was freed from the last occupant (we were dropping off our bags prior to check in to explore the city). I then told the staff member if I was not receiving a receipt he could give me my money back, which at first he was unwilling to do. Eventually he gave me back the cash (which I now had to carry around London until we could fully check into the room). The room was cold as all we had was a personal heater. The second time we stayed there before returning to the States was the worst display of customer service I have ever seen. Their credit card machine was fixed by then (two weeks later). We get up to the room and it's Freezing! As we were leaving for a play we infomed the staff and were told that the heat was broken (something I feel guests should be informed of when they check in) and they would send up a space heater while we were out. We returned back and no space heater was there. So I went downstairs and asked for it and was told extremely rudely that the staff member could not do anything until the night person came (why, I don't know), but that he would send up extra blankets. We feel asleep and woke up 2 hours later and no one had come up to the room (I was using my winter coat as a blanket now), so my boyfriend went downstairs to ask what the problem was. The staff member then brought him Sheets! Sheets! Like they would rectify the problem of a freezing cold room. We used our coats that night to stay warm. The next morning we woke up to take showers - no hot water. We went downstairs and were told not only was there no heat, but there was no hot water either (once again something I felt we should have been told). Apparently they left the hot water for the top floor rooms and were giving guests keys to those rooms to take their showers. So we had to go to our room and get everything we needed for our shower, bring it upstairs to take one, then go back downstairs to pack up to leave. Utterly the worst service/stay I have ever had at a hotel (including hostels!). Pay the extra money and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!”
Reviews.Author: Macky300
Reviews.Content: This Hotel should be closed down before someone is seriously burned by the scalding hot water from the shower, sink and the toilet! YES - the TOILET! We moved rooms 3 times and all the rooms had the same problem which the owners have known about for a long time, (see other reviews). I managed to get cold water for about 3 minutes before it returned to scalding hot again, so hot that you could make your morning cup of tea. The rooms are basically single size with a double bed thrown in, the mattress didn't even fit the base and in the other room the door didn't open properly because of the bed. The TV in the rooms we tried all had poor reception and I had to fix the aerial on the one. The window in the one room was held ajar with the kettle and in the other room as we slid the window open, it fell out of its groove. The floors were dusty and the carpets grubby. Cannot book in to 3pm and have to vacate at 11am. Even at 3pm the room hadn't been cleaned. The staff are from various countries and the female receptionist from Hungary was very rude! The breakfast is a a basic DIY and the old toasters take a good 5 minutes to brown the toast. I bet Prince William has never been there! Typical overpriced London dump! What must the foreign tourists think of this country when they see hotels like this! The owners should be ashamed of themselves! How do they sleep at night? Don't give them your money - stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PPCP
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have stayed in. The TV did not have any signal and I had to fix it myself as the person sitting at the counter had no clue how to tune the TV. There was no cold water in the taps and the water was too scalding hot to take a shower. They changed my room in the morning, but in the new room also the shower did not have any cold water. Hence I left the hotel without a shower at all. The breakfast is too plain. Not worth paying a penny for this, and I wouldn't stay there again even if they paid me to.

Reviews.Title: “Second Worst Hotel I've Ever Experienced...”
Reviews.Author: spakitten
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for me by my boss as I am working in London for 2 weeks. I've stayed here for a week now and I have never been so depressed in my whole life. The lobby and lounge smell of curry and my room smelled reminiscent of a nursing home. My first room was small and tatty. The sheets were clean, but the bed was so uncomfortable I couldn't sleep. The final straw was after a terrible nights sleep, the shower in the morning was cold. I complained and to their credit, reception was very helpful. When I got back from work they had found me another room and had moved my bags for me. However, my new room was even smaller. There was no lighting and no heater. So, I complained again. Reception was very helpful again, and immediately found me a much bigger room, with light, heat and hot water! Bingo! But not too much to ask, surely!? My final room was much better than the previous efforts, but far from nice. Much bigger, the bathroom was perfectly accpetable, but the room generally was very tatty, furnishings ripped, flooring tatty and damaged, and generally smelled bad. The television had a very poor picture, and the tea and coffee facilities looked filthy and the kettle dangerous. It had been repaired poorly with some kind of sealant. Breakfast was surprisingly impressive (possibly because my expecatiations were so low...) cereal, toast and fruit juice which was perfectly adequate, and fairly nice coffee! Overall, this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. I am here for work and will be taking this up with my boss when I get back to work. If I had to pay to stay here myself, I simply wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “They Are Scammers”
Reviews.Author: Binnn
Reviews.Content: I booked thru the internet (booking.com) but when I turned up, they said there were no rooms available. They lied to me saying it was due to some kind of error on the web site. They even said I had to confirm by phone beforehand when I had the confirmation document in hand. But after few days they took money from my credit card. When I phoned them, they said they took my money because I didn't show up and argued saying they don't have any evidence of my presence on the day. They are SCAMMERS. The hotel staffs are also not very friendly, they are rude. Do not trust them...

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: gilesN
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the WORSE HOTEL I have ever stayed in. It was dirty, there was no hot water, the TV was broken and the rooms smelt of curry. We walked out of the hotel, crossed the road a stayed in the nice hotel for the same price. Please do the same. This is a horrible hotel!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews say”
Reviews.Author: MaggieDorset
Reviews.Content: Date: Dec 1st 2007 Were really worried about the hotel after reading the reviews, but it really isn't as bad as people say. Room 23 was small and the furniture a bit tatty , but it was clean , the bed was clean and comfortable, and the ensuite clean and very new. There was tea and coffee making facility and a TV. The staff were friendly on reception and the breakfast was fine - juice, cereal , toast and tea or coffee. It is cheap and cheerful, and perfectly adequate. Well positioned for central London. However we wouldn't recommend the Indian Restaurant opposite side of the road - waited 45 minutes for the food and it was luke warm and not very good at all.

Reviews.Title: “I joined tripadvisor just to review this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeepinoutwest
Reviews.Content: Ok, Ive stayed in a lot of places and my time is valuable so, I am willing to spend a few minutes to save the rest of you from my fate. First, i pulled down the bed cover to find someone elses hairs on the sheets. I promptly asked them to change the sheets. After 5 hours I returned to the hotel and it was still not done. I asked for new sheets again and was handed them and had to change the bed myself. Second, they claim to have internet access on hotels.com, they lied, no internet access just a coy smile when asked about it. Third, Both the hot and cold water come out burning hot making it impossible to wash hands or modulate a decent shower temp. Forth, the mattress was very old, inexpensive and uncomforatble. Fifth, the walls are so thin I heard my neighbors normal volume conversations clear as day. Sixth, I asked for a wake up call, it never came. Seventh, there was a beige blanket for the bed in the closet, it had a 10" circular red stain, I cannot confirm it was blood but i assume so. Needless to say, it was awful. Good luck on your trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place in the center”
Reviews.Author: IvanFinland
Reviews.Content: Well, I can just say it is greatly located near the Paddington, which gives possibility to very efficient London tourism. On the other and, it is the hotel with the worst ever breakfast, just some toasts in non orking toasters with cheap marmelade. The room is so tiny, but surprisingly with new and fully renovated bathrooum, nevertheless with the problems with hot and cold water. And, byt the way the wall next to my bed was heating ...the bed was worse than ever imagined.Extremely helpfull staff is a big plus. Cheap hotel, in the center, for just few nights.

Reviews.Title: “shabby”
Reviews.Author: SrJezzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, and relatively cheap- end of positive statements i can make about this hotel very cramped, shabby conditions, more like a homeless shelter than a hotel- especially when you lift back the very thin sheet that separates you from the mattress. I would not stay here again if it were free

Reviews.Title: “No cold water - boiling hot showers”
Reviews.Author: cookieSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We are still trying to get a refund from Eurostar for our stay at this hotel. We live in Switzerland and were invited to a wedding in London. We decided to spend a few days in Paris and take the Eurostar to London. We booked the hotel via Eurostar too as the package deal sounded good. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. I understand that some people may have had pleasant experiences - yes the breakfast is a decent continental breakfast. However... upon entering the hotel one is greeted by the smell of old carpets. The elevator is broken (they claim it is being repaired) and bounces up and down when it comes to a halt. In our room, the curtains had two holes in them and the floor was cracked. The sink was clogged - we resolved this by removing hair from inside. Finally, after a long trip there was no cold water in the shower! The water was boiling hot. We did our best to wash in the sink and then wanted to go sightseeing. When we informed the recptionist, he said it was normal - in this hotel one has to let the water run for a bit. I explained we had let it run for more than a bit. He promised to look into the matter. Upon our return late at night we were informed that the problem had been resolved. But when we turned the shower on, after one second we had boiling hot water again. Too tired we fell asleep and tried again in the morning. No luck. We went back to the receptionitsts who explained the only thing we could do was change rooms. However, the new room was not yet made - we were advised to return later. I explained we had a wedding to go to. No problem - we were told to move our things and take the shower in the unmade room. It was pretty unmade - the bin filled up with dirty things, the bed unmade, and piles of dirty towels on the floor for us to climb over. At least, after waiting for a few seconds, hot water arrived. We also had not clean towels. But I got hold of the housekeeper. We asked for some sort of refund, but since we booked through Eurostar and prepaid could get nothing, and have written a letter to Eurostar. The next day I discovered I had left my pyjamas in the first room. The receptionists finally traced them downstairs, proudly informing me they had been saved from the garbage bin! We've travelled a lot - even staying in a great one star bungalow in the South of France, but the bottom line is things should work. I nearly scalded my skull trying to wash my hair in the hot water before the wedding. The contrast between our stay and the wedding we finally got to was incredible. This hotel has potential. It just needs someone to care.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: NornIronSisters
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. We arrived at the hotel 5 hours before check in. This was not a problem as we were allowed to put our bags in a room so we were able to note waste the day go out and do whatever. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms are very basic but extremely clean. There a kettle in the room for tea and coffee and a TV. The next day there was no cold water in the shower but as soon as we informed reception they changed our room immediately without hesitation. My sister had left a teddy bear behind in the room but when we returned to the hotel that night the teddy bear was left in our room along with a newspaper which we left to be thrown out. We were extremely impressed by this. Reception has hairdryers, irons and an ironing board if needed. We had our room cleaned and beds made daily and clean towels every day. Breakfast was self-service which was great if you were 5/10 mins late going down to get breakfast. We had the choice of 2 tube stations, Lancaster Gate & Paddington which is less than 5 mins away. This hotel is value for money and we will deftly be back! Christina & Ashleen, Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience you can get for your money.”
Reviews.Author: atoom
Reviews.Content: Worst experience you can get for the money. This hotel is by far the worst I have ever stayed at. When my wife and I arrived we where offered a room so small that there was no room for opening the suitcase. Aside from this the room had the following defects: The room was very noisy due to the elevator located next to the room. The bed was worn out and squeaked every time it was touched. Fungus and water damage had gotten the better of the shower and the bathroom was so small that it was impossible to sit straight on the toilet as it almost touched the sink. Finally the television and shawing light in the bathroom was out of order. Housekeeping did apparently only tidy the bed on Prince William Hotel, as dust and dirt was all over the room. After seeing the room we decided to complaint about this to the hotel. The clerk in the reception did not see the problem and told us that this was the standard of the hotel. In fact he did not give a damn, but after some arguing he was persuaded into giving us a new room the following day (he argued that there was no spare rooms). So the next day (after spending a night in the noisy cabinet of a room we was complaining about) we got a new room. Even though this room was bigger than the first one it was in fact even worse. All the furniture was worn down, and the window to the street was broken, allowing smoke and noise to enter the room from the street. The bed was as bad as in the first room, and the room itself was just as dirty. The ventilation in the bathroom was out of order and the water in the shower and sink was boiling. The solution to this problem was according to hotel staff that we used the bathroom in some of the other rooms already occupied by guests of the hotel. Complaining over this to the hotel clerk resulted in him insulting us and claiming that this was the case for all the rooms â€“ Even though he knew that we knew he was lying. Yet again after arguing with him and insisting to talk to the manager we got a new room. The new room was still not clean â€“ Some dirty towels where left by housekeeping and there was piss stains on the toilet and floor of the bathroom. Behind the worn-down furniture there was dirt and dust, along with some garbage the housekeeper apparently had missed. Apart from this we had the â€˜pleasureâ€™ of experiencing one power outage and two false fire alarms while staying on Prince William Hotel. Furthermore old dirty water was left in the tea water boiler in all of the rooms we where in, rendering this facility useless. Do NOT go to this hotel, and if you do then be prepared to fight the hotel staff for basic necessities, as these are rare at Prince William Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Poodlecrazy
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly when travelling to London. It is within 5 minutes of Paddington station and is friendly, clean and efficient. The reception staff are always friendly (although there is a lady who is sometimes there and can't quite crack a smile!) the others are all 100%. Rooms vary from very small to quite decent, but they all are big enough to do the job! I have never had any difficulty in finding enough storage for my luggage and clothes etc. Everything is basic, 5 channel tv etc, but always clean and fresh. Bathrooms seem to have been recently rennovated and are all similar and clean with a supply of shampoo and soap. I have never had the breakfast (not much of an early bird!) but everyone seems content when leaving the breakfast room. In terms of value for money and location I believe you will not find better. I for one will keep returning.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own hot water for a shower”
Reviews.Author: aquasun25
Reviews.Content: the showers didn't have any hot water for the time I was staying there and the hotel staff advised that it was related to everyone taking a shower in the morning. In the evening it was that there was no one ot handle the problem. Please I appeal to fellow tourists, students and everyone who is going to make the mistake of book there, bring your own hot water and maybe other basics, you might also want to bring a heater to keep the place warm in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: richieflame
Reviews.Content: Prince William is nothing fancy, small room, table and chair, television with 5 channels and a shower. Each floor shares a moderate restroom. I found it to be quite comfortable and clean, plus a good bargain! It's located in a nice part of London with a few good pubs not more than a 5 minute walk away. I walked to Old Ben, Buckingham Palace and Kensington in less than three hours one day, in the rain .I liked the complimentary breakfast each morning and the toast, cheese, juice and cornflakes were all fresh and delicious. Perfect for someone traveling alone or with a friend. Only complaint was the women who worked there, they weren't as friendly as the men and enjoyed scolding me for having a friend stay the night and my costly in-room phone bill. Other than that there aren't any bugs or anything like that!

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: lenevil
Reviews.Content: What should have been a nice couple of days in London ended up as the worst experience I have ever had on a Hotel. Between my room and the room next to me there was a thin door which meant I hardly got any sleep the first night because of a crying baby. The second night the smell of smoke coming from the neighbour room was occupying my room. Further more sleeping on my stomach I have been filled with bites from what I believe must have been bed fleas (see photo). Travelling a lot I am very disgusted by the whole situation. I e-mailed the Hotel suggesting them to give me an compensation but have not got any response at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed at the Prince William”
Reviews.Author: Quay
Reviews.Content: The photos we viewed were not an accurate depiction of the real room. The place was in need of cleaning and paint. The twin beds looked like portable cots with sagging mattresses that were very thin. The bedspreads were old and dirty. The room appeared to need a good cleaning. The bathroom needed repair and was uninviting to use. The bedroom door lock had no security lock. It reeked of curry. We arrived early and asked to see the room but we were refused.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: LondonTripoli
Reviews.Content: I booked a three day stay at this hotel because it seemed to be good value for money. I arrived late due to a train delay at 1930 hours. The receptionist said she was fully booked and that my online reservation was worthless because I should have arrived by 1600 hours or phoned ahead. The woman on reception was very rude and told me I would lose one days money on my credit card booking. I asked to see the manager; and explained my situation, I had been travelling all day from Scotland and I was desperate for a bed. The manager agreed to put me up in a staff room (not en-suite) only with a hand wash basin. I accepted and ignored the inconvenience of a tiny room with single bed and used bedding. I slept on top of the bed, so as to avoid contamination from soiled sheets. Around 0330 in the morning I was awoken by someone who had entered the room with a key and was standing by the bed. I was shocked as he/she turned on the light. It was a transexual, friend of the staff personel's room I was staying in. He/she asked where was Lars? I said I did not know, and I was sleeping here tonight. He/she left, and I had trouble getting back to sleep, so I barricaded the door with my baggage. In the morning, I asked at reception whether I could have a standard room for the next two nights. Again, the receptionist was rude and said; sorry, the management want you to leave immediately. I would be charged one day stay on my credit card and two days would be refunded. I asked if I could take breakfast before I left, she shrugged and pointed to a staircase leading down into a basement, self service kitchen. The breakfast on offer was disgusting. Eggs congealed, hot dog sausages and burnt toast, and a nasty notice insisting only one glass of juice per customer, additional glasses 75 pence. Coffee whitener only available and surly breakfast staff who spoke little English. I returned to my room (the staff room) to collect my luggage; as I entered the door was propped open for the cleaners, and a cleaner had opened my suitcase and was flicking through my photograph album of my children. I was stunned. I noticed many safety issues during my stay; fire doors were propped open and windows were suspect, piles of laundry and other furniture blocked fire escape routes and I was speaking to a lady in the lounge whilst waiting for my taxi, she said some of her clothing had been stolen from a wardrobe during her stay, which seemed odd and rather unpleasant. Do not stay in this hotel. Personally; I should have demanded my money back (onto my credit card) and found another place, after I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Terrible”
Reviews.Author: grillo6391
Reviews.Content: The staff was kindly, room very small but clean, I found it not so terrible as I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking ! Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: vincentfrance
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmation paid on Hotels. When I walk in at 21:10 I was just told that the hotel was fully booked and that they cancelled my reservation. I still have to check if my credit card have been refunded. No help have been given for finding another hotel. Terrible customer service. Rude receptionist and not helpful

Reviews.Title: “Zero stars”
Reviews.Author: kass_lola
Reviews.Content: Grim, filthy, unsafe and unfriendly. Stay away from this place, there are a lot of cheap hotels in Bayswater area.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfyed customer”
Reviews.Author: jpdk
Reviews.Content: After to have read all the previos guests bad comments about this hotel, it was with bad feelings and suspicios minds we travelled to London to stay on Prince William for a 4 night stay. We surely got surprised. The receptionist was kind, and took care of our bags, all through we arrived to the hotel at 11 am, instead of check in time at 3 pm, after a trip to the city we came back to thr hotel at 18pm, we got our room, which was kind a small, but clean and friendly, the bathroom was surprishing pretty and clean, lots of towels changed daily, plenty of hot water even at the 3rd floor. Breakfast room was also nice and clean, with plenty of bread, juice, cheese and marmelade, not to mention a very delicios coffee. At all of our stay, we only met kind receptionists, the room, bath and bed was welldone and well-cleaned daily. At the check-out day, the receptionist again took care of our bags, so we could reach yet another day in London, before our evening plane took off. In fact we never found any reason to any complain. Ofcause Prince William is not Hilton, but for a two star hotel, its above average in its standard, and I can recommand it to who, there need a good bed to sleep in, and a nice bathroom, and dont need any luxury. In fact, We would visit Prince William again. next time our holiday goes to London. Mr Petersen from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Please, Dont go there, It's an accident waiting to happen”
Reviews.Author: DerekBeggs
Reviews.Content: I recently had the misfortune of visiting this hotel. Although I was actually charged for the room, I refused to stay there for the following reasons. Apart from the rude and uncaring attitude of the receptionist, I also found. 1 the wooden floors in the hallway were filthy and the 2 inch gap in the sides contained cockroaches and ants. 2 The vents from the kitchen allowed all the smoke and grease back into the bedrooms. 3 The lift is heavily vandalised, does not work to all floors and is poorly maintained 4 The corridors to the rooms upstairs are blocked with old bed frames and childrens cots. 5 There are no signs indicating fire escapes or exit routes that I could see. 6 Fire doors in the staircase were propped open with wet towels. 7 The beds appeared to be unmade and there were dirty coffee cups in the room. 8 There appeared to be insects in and under the bed. 9 The previous guest had had articles of her personal belongings stolen and I did not feel safe to leave mine there. Your receptionist was rude, arrogant and dismissive to this woman traveller. She personally recommended that I not stay there 10 On viewing the room, and complaining, I discovered that your receptionist had already taken the money from my credit card before I had given him permission. 11 Further guests that I asked had similar complaints. As you can imagine, I was shocked at the poor and unsafe quality of the hotel and spent the night in a real hotel. I am most surprised that such a slum can be operating when London will be the focus of the worlds attention in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerfull!”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Helsinki
Reviews.Content: I was really suspicious after reading all these horreondous rewiews that the former guests have written. Now I really donÂ´t understand why everybody is complaining!? Hotels in London are expensive but I got a good bargain in Prince Albert (single room for 24 pounds). The room was warm, toilet clean, water hot. The bed was nothing special but sheets were clean. It was the coldest spring in London since 1987 but I had it nice and cosy in my small room. Breakfast was coffee, tea, toast, jam, butter, cheese and juice. It called a continental breakfast! They offered me a room at basement but I asked for a room with a window and was given one. And if you stay in the city, why complain about the noise: wear ear-plugs! I have seen much worse hotels in Rome and Madrid: cold, gloomy and price is about the same. This is Europe and if you want better quality with this prize, why not travel to Bangkok or Beijing!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty grim hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Prince William for 1 night and that was a night too long!! The double room we stayed in was so small we couldn't both stand up in the room at the same time, the room was dirty, and the standard of bedlinen wasn't good. However the bathroom wasn't too bad and was clean at least. The room had an interconnecting door to the next room where you might as well have invited the guests next door in as you could hear them so well. Customer care and job satitsfaction seems lacking here by the receptionist and manager. There was no hot water at all and when we complained were sent upto another room which was 2 flights of stairs up where surprise surprise there was no hot water. We were informed that as this hotel is in an old house there can be problems with water pressure and only after a lengthy converstation with a sour manager about the basic requirements of hot water in a hotel did we get a small amount taken off the cost of the room. We didn't risk breakfast and would have to say it is the worst hotel we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Sapnas
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the hostile hostel from hell! This seedy old dive is a hideously hateful hovel that probably wouldnâ€™t be bad enough for Satan! It really is the PITS. On entering the room, the acrid stench of cheap pine disinfectant made my eyes burn. There was a half-full cup of putrid cold tea on the â€œhostility trayâ€� resplendent with its own formed skin of congealed gunk on the top. The bed had been slept in & the sheets not changed. The phone would not allow outgoing calls. The TV reception was so grainy it was literally unwatchable. The room had an internal door interconnecting with the neighbouring room, allowing next doorâ€™s noise to penetrate into your room, almost as if the neighbouring guests were actually with you IN your room. No milk, only powdered â€œcreamer,â€� (expiry date May 2003 - I stayed there in Sep 2005!) a shower that was literally stone cold, staff that could not give a damn, and just dry toast for breakfast (the jam & butter had run out!). Save your money and sleep on a park bench on Bayswater Road - honestly, itâ€™s be more comfortable! Have stayed in zero star rated hotels that are ten times better than this dump. If you think Iâ€™m exaggerating, just try staying there. Youâ€™ll soon discover that its so-called â€œfacilitiesâ€� â€œamenitiesâ€� and â€œservicesâ€� are totally incongruent with a 3 star rating. A hotel where you canâ€™t eat, relax, wash properly or sleep! This place just oozes discomfort and unpleasantness from every weeping pore! And I'm not exaggerating! Yuck! You would be well advised not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few days at Prinsce William in december. Even if the room was quite cheap, the quality was disappointing. No hot water in the shower, no cettle, no possibility to get an other room and no reaction after demand for price reduction.

Reviews.Title: “OK for basic small, budget London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jogil415
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews ahead of stay, I was prepared for the worst. And I was there over a week. But it wasn't half bad. Only problem was a cold, cold room depite the best efforts of the radiator and a space heater. As I had a corner room, it meant I had two not very well insulated windows leaking cold air. Otherwise, hotel was quite good. Breakfast was more than the hard roll, juice and hot drink - they had bread for toasting (white or wheat) with some cheese and cereal (corn flakes or museli) in addition to joice (either apples or orange juice) and coffee/tea. Staff were pleasant. Other patrons ranged from the backpacking set to the more mature bunch. Asians, Europeans and Americans. Newly refurbished. I had no problem with the water - while not hot- hot, it was ok and the pressure was fine. I've sure stayed in worse! And I would return, but avoid a corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prince William Hotel London from December 12th to 15th, 2005. My single room was more like a prison cell. Sheets were not changed. No hot water in the shower. I changed the room then. I've got hot water but the water pressure for taking a shower was awful. The heating didn't work in my new room, I was freezing. The young girl at the reception from eastern Europe was not friendly, no smile, no kind word. And so on ...Would I recommend this hotel, no!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute dive, cheap and nasty.”
Reviews.Author: Tim2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night before getting the Eurostar across to Paris for a weekend. I'm very glad it wasn't any longer. The place is a health and safety nightmare! There are bare wires hanging in the halls and the lift seemed to be more than a little unreliable. I shudder to think what would happen if you were on one of the higher floors in the event of a fire!? The room was clean, and the positive notes end there. I have never seen wood flooring laid universally with a half inch gap from the wall all the way around. The bathroom was clean, but the toilet seat was loose, and the water pressure in the shower was laughable (we did actually laugh at it!). They do supply towels, but no soap or shampoo. Security was a concern, the door locks were not sturdy, and there were gaps under the doors of all the rooms that I saw. No noise insulation either. The mattress was thin and hard, although slightly better than a plank of wood. Pillows were ineffectual. Breakfast was a crazy free-for-all in a bizarre basement . The guests seemed to be largely Eastern European and nothing else, which made it even more strange. We didn't eat. I know it's cheap (we got the room for Â£44 for two of us), but really don't do this to yourself. Please!

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had to attend a wedding, we were soaked on our way to the hotel as we could not get a taxi and worst of all we were running late.The staff were fantastic, we explained to the front desk person our problem and he gave us separate rooms ( spacious rooms) to have a shower and allow my girlfriend to get ready, in the meantime he had ordered us a taxi. This was unbelievable , what a service, as the housekeeper attended ironed some of my girlfriend's clothes. We even made it on time for the wedding. For the price we paid and the service we will definitely go back. A big thank you.

Reviews.Title: “One Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Hotel and took a cold shower everyday. Both morning and night the water was cold. The mattress was very uncomfortable and it was like sleeping on the floor. Expect a very small room but this is not out of the ordinary for London Hotels. The breakfast consisted of toast, cereal, and juice, coffee or tea. Not many choices. I would not stay at this Hotel again. The price may be lower but you get less than what you pay for. The only good thing about the Hotel was it's convenient location near Paddington Station and the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS IN 36 AND 44”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and everything seemed lovely, we were welcomed by friendly enough staff and the rooms looked ok at first glance. The first night was ok, the bed bugs appear that night however... I woke up at about 2ish in the second night and was thought i had woken up in some nightmare there were about 8 bugs crawling about over the bed. to make matters worse, because it was such a hot night and the fan was crap, we slept in little clothing revealing me tempting flesh for the bed bugs to bite. the bed bugs were pretty big althought they did vary in size. they were beetle- type looking, small black heads with a massive sack on their backs full of blood. i still feel sick just describing them. when you hit them all the blood squirts out - it was really awful. We complained but the didnt care about our problems. We still had another 3 nights left. it was pretty much the same 3rd 4th and 5th night. i tucked the quilt into the mattress thinking they were living in the mattress. however i was mistaken becuase on our last morning when we were packing i pulled the bed away from the wall to check incase anything had fallen down there. i was greeted by between 20-30 bugs all gathered in a group on the skirting board. The majority of them had backs full of blood. the bugs are very distinctive looking and impossible to miss. Some of them were bigger then 5p pieces absolutely sickening. i was screaming and jumping around at the site of them - they make my skin crawl. Dont go to this hotel, it was terrible we only had our room cleaned and bed linen changed on the 2nd day aswell as the room being infested by bugs. Afew bed bugs were also spotted in my friends room, room 44. DONT go to this hotel. save your skin.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs! Nice staff, Broken toilet seat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: FIrst night had bed bugs that bit all night. I still have bites that are healing. Went to complain at the front desk and the first thing he said was " Are you checking out then?" I said no, I would like to know what they planned on doing to take care of the problem. They offered to change rooms. New room was a little bigger and did not seem to have any bugs. No shower curtian, water pressure was low. I recommend taking shower in evening as trying to take a shower in the am, you will take a cold shower. Toilet seat was broken. We had to hold onto the wall to keep the seat from pinching our buttocks. Told staff and nothing was done about it while we were there. ( We were there a total of 9 days) No washcloths, but new towels everyday. Mattresses have seen better days and they had flat, hard pillows. Rooms were hot, and the small fan they provided, the cord would not reach the window, so we could pull cool air into the room. Remote control only turned the tv on. would not change the channels. Walls were very thin and we heard the neighbors tv and conversations every day. It would be helpful only if you were in trouble and needed help Breakfast consisted of toast, cereal,tea, juice and coffee. Staff was friendly, but I definately would not return. The bed bugs certianly did it for me. The hotel was close to many tourist sites and pubs with good food. If you can deal with the problems we had, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Galore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel because of the proximity to London. Reading your reviews I was convinced a previous guest was watching Big Brother on the TV. It was very hot so the window was open all the time. I thought the bed bugs I killed were beetles that had flown in. Until my wife had an alergic reaction to "BED BUGS" bite. Medical treatment confirmed this and a course of anti-hystamines slowly controlled the forty or so itchy bites all over her body. They took 4 weeks to disappear. Do not stay in this Hotel. Cheap is what it is, cheap is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Were a bit concerned with the previous remarks, but when we arrived there we were pleasantly surprise to see a tidy reception and obviously newly fitted carpet. Very helpful staff, specially whislt arranging for theatre and sightseeing tickets. Very clean room, very bright and the laminated wooden flooring helps very much. We have stayed in similar hotels before with tiny and dirty bathroom but we have to say that the bathroom was fantastic, all tiled up!.Love the red high chairs in the breakfast room. For the price we paid we will diefinetly go back as it is in a prime location. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights in May 2005. We were slightly concerned when we arrived and saw an old upturned toilet pan, old beds and other rubbish piled up outside! The reception area was tatty with missing carpet on the stairs. There was a sign appologising for the mess due to 'refurbishment' but we suspect this may have been there for some time! We'd booked a double room but were given a room with 3 single beds cramed in so tight that we could not open the wardrobe doors! We had to literally climb over the beds. The whole hotel was very tatty. Breakfast was a complete joke - no coffee cups, a sad looking stack of cheese slices a pile of white bread and a long queue of people waiting for a slow toaster. The breakfast room was obviously a curry house at night. We walked out and sought breakfast elsewhere. The hotel website boast 3 English Tourist Board Crowns but the sticker on the door actually says 2002 and I suspect that it's changed hands since then (now run by Asians)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Prince”
Reviews.Author: frannie046
Reviews.Content: We were a bit hesitant because of the reviews, but we took the chance because of the fantastic discount and the excellent location. We check in early in the morning, we were tired from our flight but surprisingly the receptionist was very hepful and got a room ready for us in 30 minutes. Very clean room specially with the wooden flooring it looks brighter, nicely tiled bathroom and vey well decorated breakfast room. Will stay there again. Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there cause of the great deal I got. Friendly staff, excellent location very convenient in terms of going around the city and night buses helps too. Room was ok but but he bathrooms was of a very good standard. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the receptionist could barely speak English. We were given keys to room 25 but when we got to the room we found clothes and dirty washing in the wardrobe! We were then moved to a room in the basement which was not clean and was extremely basic. We were kept up all night by the noise of people using the toilet next to our bedroom. Breakfast was very basic. I'm still itching a week later. If you're staying in London it is worth paying the extra money for a decent hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Prince William Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 42-44 Gloucester Terrace, London W2 3DA, England
